issue.title: Splitwise App
issue.body:
## Build expense-sharing app

**Features:**
- Google OAuth login
- Create groups, add expenses
- Split equally, view balances

**Tech:** Next.js 14, Tailwind, shadcn/ui, SQLite, NextAuth.js

**Pages:** Landing, Login, Dashboard, Group detail

ems.task: Create project foundation with Next.js 14 setup, including package.json with all dependencies (NextAuth, Google OAuth provider, better-sqlite3, shadcn/ui, Tailwind), tsconfig.json with strict mode, .gitignore for Next.js, and initialize basic project structure (app/ directory, components/, lib/, prisma/ for SQLite schema).
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Implement authentication system and database layer. Create NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth provider, design and implement SQLite database schema for users, groups, expenses, and balances using Prisma ORM. Build all database models, migrations, and seed data. Owns: lib/auth.ts, lib/prisma.ts, prisma/schema.prisma, app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts.

workers.task: Create NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth provider. Set up lib/auth.ts with NextAuth configuration including Google provider, session management, and user callbacks.
Set up Prisma ORM and SQLite database. Create lib/prisma.ts for Prisma client singleton and configure database connection. Handle environment variables for database URL.

Design and implement complete Prisma schema. Create prisma/schema.prisma with User, Group, Expense, and Balance models with all necessary relations and fields. Create initial migration. Add seed data for testing.

ems.task: Build core application logic and API routes. Implement group creation/management, expense creation with equal splitting logic, balance calculation algorithms, and all CRUD operations. Create RESTful API endpoints for groups and expenses. Owns: app/api/groups/, app/api/expenses/, lib/calculations.ts, lib/actions.ts for server actions.

workers.task: Create group management system with TypeScript types, database schema, and CRUD operations. Implement lib/db/schema.ts for group tables, lib/db/index.ts for database connection, lib/actions/groups.ts for group server actions, and app/api/groups/route.ts with app/api/groups/[id]/route.ts for REST endpoints.

Create expense management system with TypeScript types, database schema, and CRUD operations. Implement lib/types/expenses.ts for expense types, lib/db/expenses-schema.ts for expense tables, lib/actions/expenses.ts for expense server actions, and app/api/expenses/route.ts with app/api/expenses/[id]/route.ts for REST endpoints.

Create balance calculation system with equal splitting logic. Implement lib/calculations/balance.ts for balance calculation algorithms, lib/calculations/split.ts for expense splitting logic, and lib/calculations/validation.ts for input validation utilities.

ems.task: Create all UI components and pages. Build landing page, login/logout flow, dashboard with group overview, group detail pages with expense lists and balance views. Integrate shadcn/ui components (Button, Card, Input, Dialog, etc.) with Tailwind styling. Owns: app/page.tsx, app/login/page.tsx, app/dashboard/page.tsx, app/group/[id]/page.tsx, components/ui/, components/expense-form.tsx, components/balance-card.tsx.

workers.task: Create shadcn/ui components infrastructure and core UI components. Initialize shadcn/ui with npx, install dependencies, create components.json config, and build Button, Card, Input, Dialog, and Label components in components/ui/ directory.

Build authentication pages (landing and login) and main dashboard. Create app/page.tsx (landing), app/login/page.tsx (OAuth login), and app/dashboard/page.tsx (group overview). Use shadcn Button and Card components.

Build group detail page and custom expense/balance components. Create app/group/[id]/page.tsx (expense list, balances), components/expense-form.tsx (add expense dialog), and components/balance-card.tsx (member balance display). Use all shadcn components.

analysisSummary: Build a complete expense-sharing application with Google OAuth authentication, group management, expense tracking, and balance calculations. Tech stack: Next.js 14, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui components, SQLite database, and NextAuth.js.
